column5: Glad to see these random checks ocurring, Havelock Lake is pretty remote.  http://www.haliburtonecho.ca/ArticleDisplay.aspx?e=3214261
Unfortunately, this is waaaay to common on that lake. There are a fair # of locals that believe that the regs don't apply shore-lunch fish.

Awesome to see the Minden boys bustin' chumps.  Really burns me up to see people keeping the slotters that I release.  A cottager across the bay last summer says "yeah, we just had a big fry...cooked up 18 of'em....been savin'em."  Not even bothering with possession limits, I ask him if he is aware of the slot limit.  "Oh, yeah, I heard about that, but, we don't catch that many, so we just keep whatever we get." HE proceeded to describe his boat to me, so I could say hi when I'm on the water.  I proceeded to text that info to the Minden CO
